argument.name: stopwhendocked
argument.desc: stop if leader is docked at same

argument.name: stopwhenOOS
argument.desc: stop if leader is out of sector

line.comment: * Task 0.
* Target priority: 1/ $protectit, 2/ $attacksame, 3/ $attacknearest.
* doesn't work with formations
* do if [THIS]-> is in fleet
* follower scanning range breaks. Doesn't register changes when in formation mode
* $useFormations = null
* squadron leaders on protect duty wouldn't work
* same for merc leaders
* do if [THIS]-> is fleet leader
* and player fleet leaders
* $useFormations = null
* safety
* Mordan9
* By setting this to a low value, it forces Followers in a squadron to avoid attacking the leaders target until the leader
* gets fairly close. Otherwise, the followers may surge way ahead of the leader.
* However, for the 'raider' type of squadron, we want the followers to take off like a bat out of hell and attack as
* quickly as possible, not waiting for the leader, because the leader is the slowest ship in the fleet.
* $stopwhenOOS isn't passed, but we don't care.
* Fleet special behavior.
* ZH 1.5: Fleet Follower scanning range is now handled by the commander himself with ZH.Task.FleetCommander on task 1331
* if !$retreatSector
* $target = [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.Fleet.SelectTarget' : ship=[THIS]
* if $target-> exists
* = [THIS]-> call script '!fight.attack.object' : target=$target follow=[FALSE] onlyShields=[FALSE] timeoutSeconds=$attackTimeout
* goto label Restart:
* end
* end
* If leader is being attacked, defend it.

* Add-Ons 1.4.11: Fix a nasty bug where follow command can cause a follower's ships to attack an attacker on the same side! Have to check if the leader's attacker and the leader's followers are allies or not.
* Mordan6 add switch set in cheat menu.
* Mordan2 - adjust $attackMaxDistance and $attacksame here.
* If this is a fighter, and leader is a Carrier, the $attackMaxDistance restriction completely negates the ability of the Carrier to project it's power using Fighters at a distance.

* This IS the primary responsibility of a Carrier; to project it's power via it's fighters. We override that behavior here, even if fleet settings for the followers are set to not engage the commanders target.
* Docked fleet fighters will not launch until the carrier comes within it's own scanner range of a target.
* Note, this logic does NOT apply to fighters home-based at the carrier, which are considered "support fighters" and have their own logic. I'd love to change those, but it's too much.
* If the fleet is led by a carrier and this is a fighter in the fleet, but NOT a support fighter home-based at the carrier, consider this a "Fleet Fighter" and project carrier power with it.
* now force "Fleet Fighters" to attack whatever the carrier is attacking, regardless of whether it's a station or not. This overrides the 3.18 comment below.
* Carrier "Fleet Fighters" are an extension of a carrier itself, and not a standard fleet follower. They represent the carrier and we use the carrier scanning range.
* If carrier can repair damage, check hull damage on fighter. If it's below 25% hull, don't send it out to fight unless a target is right on top of us. Give the fighter a chance to rep up.
* end Mordan2
* Attack the leader's target, but only if the leader is within X distance.

* Add-Ons 1.4.11: Fix a nasty bug where follow command can cause a follower's ships to attack a target on the same side! Have to check if the leader's target and the leader's followers are allies or not.
* ZH 2.0 capships never get close to stations anymore due to generally increased laser ranges
* $target = $leader-> find nearest enemy ship: max.dist=$maxDistance
* nobody attacks Terraformers in a sector which is protected by Phanon
* ** ZH 2.0 - fixing Xenon followers who still attack unintended targets
* Terraformer owned ships do not attack Terraformer made ships
* Terraformers dont attack anything if sector is protected by Phanon
* Player owned OCV ships do not attack Terraformer made ships because their virus would turn them

* should there be no target at this point this follower would need to loop through all ships in his sector in order to maybe get a valid target which is further away than the nearest enemy. But for performance reasons we only do this on the lead ship. He would notice and close the distance for the entire fleet. This compromise seems acceptable.
* We don't call !move.movetoobject because we need the follow command to return after $timeout.
* formations
* Mordan3 - Most annoying thing is commanding my ship to follow someone and they get so freekin close to the target that I'm constantly swerving. stupid. Extend this.
* = [THIS]-> escort ship $target
* temetvince
* ZH 1.3: don't escort stations with formation!
* ZH 1.3: adding a timeout!!!
* The AI will recycle damaged ships.
* Preliminary checks.
* skip if $leader-> is of class [Moveable Ship]
* return null
* Is leader docked or out of sector?
* $nextSector = [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.GetNextSectorOnRoute' : ship=[THIS] destination=$leader.sector
* = [THIS]-> call script '!move.movetosector' : targetsector=$nextSector
* Mordan2

* Prevent ships from automatically docking at any lead carrier other than their own home base. We want to avoid having non-support fighters and M6's from taking up docking slots on a ship that they don't belong to.
* End Mordan2
* Only dock at lead carrier IF it's their home-base.

sval.val: Low level follow code
target ship
protect the ship
attack same target
attack nearest enemy
stop if leader is docked at same
stop if leader is out of sector
Task 0.
Target priority: 1/ $protectit, 2/ $attacksame, 3/ $attacknearest.
doesn't work with formations
do if [THIS]-> is in fleet
follower scanning range breaks. Doesn't register changes when in formation mode
$useFormations = null
squadron leaders on protect duty wouldn't work
same for merc leaders
do if [THIS]-> is fleet leader
and player fleet leaders
$useFormations = null
By setting this to a low value, it forces Followers in a squadron to avoid attacking the leaders target until the leader
gets fairly close. Otherwise, the followers may surge way ahead of the leader.
However, for the 'raider' type of squadron, we want the followers to take off like a bat out of hell and attack as
quickly as possible, not waiting for the leader, because the leader is the slowest ship in the fleet.
$stopwhenOOS isn't passed, but we don't care.
Fleet special behavior.
ZH 1.5: Fleet Follower scanning range is now handled by the commander himself with ZH.Task.FleetCommander on task 1331
if !$retreatSector
$target = [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.Fleet.SelectTarget' : ship=[THIS]
if $target-> exists
= [THIS]-> call script '!fight.attack.object' : target=$target follow=[FALSE] onlyShields=[FALSE] timeoutSeconds=$attackTimeout
goto label Restart:
If leader is being attacked, defend it.

Add-Ons 1.4.11: Fix a nasty bug where follow command can cause a follower's ships to attack an attacker on the same side! Have to check if the leader's attacker and the leader's followers are allies or not.
Mordan6 add switch set in cheat menu.
Mordan2 - adjust $attackMaxDistance and $attacksame here.
If this is a fighter, and leader is a Carrier, the $attackMaxDistance restriction completely negates the ability of the Carrier to project it's power using Fighters at a distance.

This IS the primary responsibility of a Carrier; to project it's power via it's fighters. We override that behavior here, even if fleet settings for the followers are set to not engage the commanders target.
Docked fleet fighters will not launch until the carrier comes within it's own scanner range of a target.
Note, this logic does NOT apply to fighters home-based at the carrier, which are considered "support fighters" and have their own logic. I'd love to change those, but it's too much.
If the fleet is led by a carrier and this is a fighter in the fleet, but NOT a support fighter home-based at the carrier, consider this a "Fleet Fighter" and project carrier power with it.
now force "Fleet Fighters" to attack whatever the carrier is attacking, regardless of whether it's a station or not. This overrides the 3.18 comment below.
Carrier "Fleet Fighters" are an extension of a carrier itself, and not a standard fleet follower. They represent the carrier and we use the carrier scanning range.
If carrier can repair damage, check hull damage on fighter. If it's below 25% hull, don't send it out to fight unless a target is right on top of us. Give the fighter a chance to rep up.
end Mordan2
Attack the leader's target, but only if the leader is within X distance.

Add-Ons 1.4.11: Fix a nasty bug where follow command can cause a follower's ships to attack a target on the same side! Have to check if the leader's target and the leader's followers are allies or not.
ZH 2.0 capships never get close to stations anymore due to generally increased laser ranges
$target = $leader-> find nearest enemy ship: max.dist=$maxDistance
nobody attacks Terraformers in a sector which is protected by Phanon
** ZH 2.0 - fixing Xenon followers who still attack unintended targets
Terraformer owned ships do not attack Terraformer made ships
Terraformers dont attack anything if sector is protected by Phanon
Player owned OCV ships do not attack Terraformer made ships because their virus would turn them

should there be no target at this point this follower would need to loop through all ships in his sector in order to maybe get a valid target which is further away than the nearest enemy. But for performance reasons we only do this on the lead ship. He would notice and close the distance for the entire fleet. This compromise seems acceptable.
We don't call !move.movetoobject because we need the follow command to return after $timeout.
Mordan3 - Most annoying thing is commanding my ship to follow someone and they get so freekin close to the target that I'm constantly swerving. stupid. Extend this.
= [THIS]-> escort ship $target
ZH 1.3: don't escort stations with formation!
ZH 1.3: adding a timeout!!!
The AI will recycle damaged ships.
Preliminary checks.
skip if $leader-> is of class [Moveable Ship]
return null
Is leader docked or out of sector?
$nextSector = [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.GetNextSectorOnRoute' : ship=[THIS] destination=$leader.sector
= [THIS]-> call script '!move.movetosector' : targetsector=$nextSector

Prevent ships from automatically docking at any lead carrier other than their own home base. We want to avoid having non-support fighters and M6's from taking up docking slots on a ship that they don't belong to.
End Mordan2
Only dock at lead carrier IF it's their home-base.
